Terry Stop.definition: a stop and limited search of a person for weapons justified by a police officer's reasonable conclusion that a crime is being or about to be committed by a person who may be armed and whose responses to questioning do not dispel the officer's fear of danger to the officer or to others compare reasonable suspicion
Terry Stop.origin: [from Terry v. Ohio , 392 U.S. 1 (1968), case in which the right of police to stop and question a suspect was first discussed]
